revised_title: Exploration of the Optical Properties and Unique Absorption of Light in Oxalate of Chromium and Potash
tldr: The author, David Brewster, examines the unique optical properties of the oxalate of chromium and potash, including its double refraction, color differences in images, and specific absorption of a red ray in the spectrum. This salt's properties can be used to measure the refractive powers of other materials and improve understanding of light interaction with crystals.
